meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise rattens the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The dark forest rattens me at night.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pop quiz rattens the students.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence rattens the old house.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind rattens the windows.

meanings.definition: To betray or inform on someone.
meanings.sent1: He rattens on his friends to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: She rattens out her classmates for cheating.
meanings.sent3: The spy rattens on his own country for money.
meanings.sent4: The witness rattens on the criminal in court.
meanings.sent5: The sibling rattens on the other for eating the last cookie.

meanings.definition: A person who betrays or informs on others.
meanings.sent1: The rattens caused chaos in the group.
meanings.sent2: The rattens was shunned by everyone for their actions.
meanings.sent3: The rattens regretted their decision to betray.
meanings.sent4: The rattens lived in fear of retaliation.
meanings.sent5: The rattens' name became synonymous with betrayal.
